title: Ring of invisibility
data:
**[English]()**

 • [한국어](/wiki/Ring_of_invisibility/ko "Ring of invisibility/ko")

| =          |                                                               |   |   |
| ---------- | ------------------------------------------------------------- | - | - |
| Name       | invisibility                                                  |   |   |
| Appearance | [random](/wiki/Randomised_appearance "Randomised appearance") |   |   |
| Base price | 150 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid")                             |   |   |
| Weight     | 3                                                             |   |   |

A **ring of invisibility** is a type of [ring](/wiki/Ring "Ring") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Description](#Description)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [4 History](#History)

- [5 Messages](#Messages)

- [6 Variants](#Variants)

  - [6.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [6.2 EvilHack](#EvilHack)
  - [6.3 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM)

- [7 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

- [8 References](#References)

## Generation

In addition to random generation, the ring of invisibility can be sold in general [shops](/wiki/Shop "Shop") and jewelers' shops.

[Nazgul](/wiki/Nazgul "Nazgul") will always generate with a cursed ring of invisibility.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

## Description

While worn, a ring of invisibility confers [invisibility](/wiki/Invisibility "Invisibility"). Wearing or removing the ring [auto-identifies](/wiki/Auto-identifies "Auto-identifies") it if you can see yourself and do not have another source of the property.

[Eating](/wiki/Eating_jewelry "Eating jewelry") the ring has a 1⁄3 chance of conferring permanent invisibility.

## Strategy

A ring of invisibility tends to be most useful early on, when most monsters lack [see invisible](/wiki/See_invisible "See invisible") - as a character becomes more adept at combat while developing and identifying their kit, the ring becomes more of a convenience saved for specific combat encounters, though it can be superseded by potions of [invisibility](/wiki/Potion_of_invisibility "Potion of invisibility") that are non-blessed. A character that wants permanent invisibility and has [mummy wrappings](/wiki/Mummy_wrapping "Mummy wrapping") to spare will usually elect for a blessed potion of invisibility or a [wand of make invisible](/wiki/Wand_of_make_invisible "Wand of make invisible") to keep their equipment slots open.

For other characters, the ring can be useful for killing [shopkeepers](/wiki/Shopkeeper "Shopkeeper") [that you plan to rob](/wiki/Stealing_from_shops "Stealing from shops") by taking advantage of their movement patterns.

## History

The ring of invisibility first appears in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0").

## Messages

- You don't see anything happen to the sink.

  You dropped a ring of invisibility down a [sink](/wiki/Sink "Sink").

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

In older versions of [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), [the One Ring](/wiki/The_One_Ring "The One Ring") appeared as an artifact ring of invisibility that served as the [Hobbit's](/wiki/Hobbit_\(starting_race\) "Hobbit (starting race)") [quest artifact](/wiki/Quest_artifact "Quest artifact"), and was guarded by [Gollum](/wiki/Gollum "Gollum") on the [Hobbit quest](/wiki/Hobbit_quest "Hobbit quest"). The One Ring would confer [drain resistance](/wiki/Drain_resistance "Drain resistance"), [half spell damage](/wiki/Half_spell_damage "Half spell damage") and [warning](/wiki/Warning "Warning") while carried, and [invoking](/wiki/Invoking "Invoking") The One Ring would toggle [conflict](/wiki/Conflict "Conflict").

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), The One Ring appears as an obtainable artifact ring of invisibility, and is always found on a random square in Gollum's Cave within [Goblin Town](/wiki/Goblin_Town "Goblin Town"). The One Ring grants [stealth](/wiki/Stealth "Stealth"), [automatic searching](/wiki/Automatic_searching "Automatic searching") and [warns of wraith-class monsters](/wiki/Warned_of_monster_type "Warned of monster type") while carried.

### SlashTHEM

In [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), The One Ring is present in the game's data as a [deferred feature](/wiki/Deferred_and_defunct_features_\(SlashTHEM\) "Deferred and defunct features (SlashTHEM)") slated for future use.

## Encyclopedia entry

"When time came for the shepherds to hold their customary  
assembly in order to prepare their monthly report to the king  
about the state of the flocks, he came too, wearing this ring.  
While he was sitting with the others, it chanced that he moved  
the collet of the ring around toward himself into the inside of  
his hand; having done this, he disappeared from the sight of  
those who were sitting beside him, and they discussed of him as  
of someone who had left. And he wondered and once again feeling  
for the ring, he turned the collet outwards and, by turning it,  
reappeared. Reflecting upon this, he put the ring to the test  
to see if it indeed had such power, and he came to this  
conclusion that, by turning the collet inwards, he became  
invisible, outwards, visible. Having perceived this, he at  
once managed for himself to become one of the envoys to the  
king; upon arrival, having seduced his wife, with her help,  
he laid a hand on the king, murdered him and took hold of the  
leadership."

\[ The Republic, by Plato, translated by James Adam ]

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 722](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/makemon.c#L722)

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")
html:
Ring of invisibility

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
English

 • 한국어

=
Name invisibility
Appearance random
Base price 150 zm
Weight 3

A ring of invisibility is a type of ring that appears in NetHack.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Description
  • 3 Strategy
  • 4 History
  • 5 Messages
  • 6 Variants
    • 6.1 SLASH'EM
    • 6.2 EvilHack
    • 6.3 SlashTHEM
  • 7 Encyclopedia entry
  • 8 References

Generation

In addition to random generation, the ring of invisibility can be sold in general shops and jewelers' shops.

Nazgul will always generate with a cursed ring of invisibility.[1]

Description

While worn, a ring of invisibility confers invisibility. Wearing or removing the ring auto-identifies it if you can see yourself and do not have another source of the property.

Eating the ring has a 1⁄3 chance of conferring permanent invisibility.

Strategy

A ring of invisibility tends to be most useful early on, when most monsters lack see invisible - as a character becomes more adept at combat while developing and identifying their kit, the ring becomes more of a convenience saved for specific combat encounters, though it can be superseded by potions of invisibility that are non-blessed. A character that wants permanent invisibility and has mummy wrappings to spare will usually elect for a blessed potion of invisibility or a wand of make invisible to keep their equipment slots open.

For other characters, the ring can be useful for killing shopkeepers that you plan to rob by taking advantage of their movement patterns.

History

The ring of invisibility first appears in NetHack 3.0.0.

Messages

You don't see anything happen to the sink.
You dropped a ring of invisibility down a sink.

Variants

SLASH'EM

In older versions of SLASH'EM, the One Ring appeared as an artifact ring of invisibility that served as the Hobbit's quest artifact, and was guarded by Gollum on the Hobbit quest. The One Ring would confer drain resistance, half spell damage and warning while carried, and invoking The One Ring would toggle conflict.

EvilHack

In EvilHack, The One Ring appears as an obtainable artifact ring of invisibility, and is always found on a random square in Gollum's Cave within Goblin Town. The One Ring grants stealth, automatic searching and warns of wraith-class monsters while carried.

SlashTHEM

In SlashTHEM, The One Ring is present in the game's data as a deferred feature slated for future use.

Encyclopedia entry

"When time came for the shepherds to hold their customary
assembly in order to prepare their monthly report to the king
about the state of the flocks, he came too, wearing this ring.
While he was sitting with the others, it chanced that he moved
the collet of the ring around toward himself into the inside of
his hand; having done this, he disappeared from the sight of
those who were sitting beside him, and they discussed of him as
of someone who had left. And he wondered and once again feeling
for the ring, he turned the collet outwards and, by turning it,
reappeared. Reflecting upon this, he put the ring to the test
to see if it indeed had such power, and he came to this
conclusion that, by turning the collet inwards, he became
invisible, outwards, visible. Having perceived this, he at
once managed for himself to become one of the envoys to the
king; upon arrival, having seduced his wife, with her help,
he laid a hand on the king, murdered him and took hold of the
leadership."

[ The Republic, by Plato, translated by James Adam ]

References

  1. ↑ src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 722

{{ring
  |name=invisibility

}}

A '''ring of invisibility''' is a type of [[ring]] that appears in ''[[NetHack]]''.

==Generation==
In addition to random generation, the ring of invisibility can be sold in general [[shop]]s and jewelers' shops.

[[Nazgul]] will always generate with a cursed ring of invisibility.{{refsrc|src/makemon.c|722|version=NetHack 3.6.7}}

==Description==
While worn, a ring of invisibility confers [[invisibility]]. Wearing or removing the ring [[auto-identifies]] it if you can see yourself and do not have another source of the property.

[[Eating jewelry|Eating]] the ring has a {{frac|3}} chance of conferring permanent invisibility.

==Strategy==
A ring of invisibility tends to be most useful early on, when most monsters lack [[see invisible]] - as a character becomes more adept at combat while developing and identifying their kit, the ring becomes more of a convenience saved for specific combat encounters, though it can be superseded by potions of {{! of|invisibility}} that are non-blessed. A character that wants permanent invisibility and has [[mummy wrapping]]s to spare will usually elect for a blessed potion of invisibility or a [[wand of make invisible]] to keep their equipment slots open.

For other characters, the ring can be useful for killing [[shopkeeper]]s [[Stealing from shops|that you plan to rob]] by taking advantage of their movement patterns.

==History==
The ring of invisibility first appears in [[NetHack 3.0.0]].

==Messages==
{{message|You don't see anything happen to the sink.|You dropped a ring of invisibility down a [[sink]].}}

==Variants==
===SLASH'EM===
In older versions of [[SLASH'EM]], [[the One Ring]] appeared as an artifact ring of invisibility that served as the [[Hobbit (starting race)|Hobbit's]] [[quest artifact]], and was guarded by [[Gollum]] on the [[Hobbit quest]]. The One Ring would confer [[drain resistance]], [[half spell damage]] and [[warning]] while carried, and [[invoking]] The One Ring would toggle [[conflict]].

===EvilHack===
In [[EvilHack]], The One Ring appears as an obtainable artifact ring of invisibility, and is always found on a random square in Gollum's Cave within [[Goblin Town]]. The One Ring grants [[stealth]], [[automatic searching]] and [[Warned of monster type|warns of wraith-class monsters]] while carried.

===SlashTHEM===
In [[SlashTHEM]], The One Ring is present in the game's data as a [[Deferred and defunct features (SlashTHEM)|deferred feature]] slated for future use.
